definition: to dress up and make up (like an actor)
to disguise oneself as/to dress up/to play (a role)/to put on (an expression)
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack

sentences.english: Transvestites should be seen as valued members of society.
sentences.chinese: 扮裝癖者應該視爲社會上有價值的成員。

sentences.english: Everyone enjoys a game of make-believe now and then.
sentences.chinese: 所有人時不時喜歡搞些扮裝遊戲。

sentences.english: "I Role Play, Therefore I Am" justifies skirt wearing in feminine role players.
sentences.chinese: 爲陰柔扮裝的人提供了穿裙裝的合理性。

sentences.english: The 501st focuses on Star Wars villain costuming.
sentences.chinese: 五零一集中與星球大戰的反派扮裝。

sentences.english: Half a durable dress-up is according to the science of the skin, the skin epidermis layer for beauty makeup.
sentences.chinese: 半耐久扮裝是根據肌膚科學，在肌膚表皮層進行美妝。

definition: organizing committee/abbr. to 組委|组委
Chishang or Chihshang township in Taitung County 臺東縣|台东县[Tai2 dong1 Xian4], southeast Taiwan
to give a small demonstration of one's impressive skills (idiom)
